bug.author: tobillsung-doc
bug.summary: tf.keras.experimental.WideDeepModel example has wrong input for constructor
bug.description:
The tutorial example for tf.keras.experimental.WideDeepModel instantiated the class with first input augment: dnn_model, and second augment: linear_model as shown in : <denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/keras/experimental/WideDeepModel#example_4>https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/keras/experimental/WideDeepModel#example_4</denchmark-link>
However, the class should be instantiated by linear_model then dnn_model as shown in: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/v2.1.0/tensorflow/python/keras/premade/wide_deep.py#L72>https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/v2.1.0/tensorflow/python/keras/premade/wide_deep.py#L72</denchmark-link>
Please update the tutorial example.

comments.comment: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tobillsung-doc>@tobillsung-doc</denchmark-link> Do you want to raise a PR to update the docs? Thanks!
